hints.content:
All of the squares show $\dfrac12$ shaded.  

However, for two fractions to be equivalent, they must refer to the same size whole.
Which answer choice shows $\dfrac12$ of the same size wholes shaded?

This pair of squares shows equivalent areas shaded:



[[☃ image 1]]

$=$

[[☃ image 2]]

options.alt: Two squares that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the squares. The top square is divided into two equal parts on the diagonal. One part is shaded. The bottom square is divided into two equal parts with a line down the middle. One part is shaded. !

Two squares that are the same size. There is an equal sign between the squares. The top square is divided into two equal parts on the diagonal. One part is shaded. The bottom square is divided into two equal parts with a line down the middle. One part is shaded. !

question.content:
**Which pair of squares have equivalent areas shaded?**


[[☃ radio 1]]
